personal-pronouns-u: Hi Maaike, will #you stay for dinner?
Pardon meneer, kunt #u even opzij gaan?
Excuse me sir, could #you step aside for a moment?
personal-pronouns-het_or_hij:
[#Het boek]
 #Het staat op de bovenste plank.

[#The book]
 #It is on the top shelf.

[#De film]
 #Hij draait momenteel in de bioscoop.

[#The film]
 #It is currently shown in the cinema.
personal-pronouns-ze_zij_or_die:
[#The shoes]
 #They look very good on you.

[#De schoenen]
 #Die staan je heel goed (die andere schoenen niet).

[#The shoes]
 #They look very good on you (those other shoes don't).

[#De ouders]
 #Ze vinden het geen goed idee.

[#The parents]
 #They do not think it is a good idea.

[#De ouders]
 #Zij vinden het geen goed idee (maar ik wel).

[#The parents]
 #They do not think it is a good idea (but I think it is).
personal-pronouns-haar_or_ze: Ik heb #haar op de markt gezien.
I have seen #her on the market.
Ik heb #ze op de markt gezien.
I have seen #her on the market.
personal-pronouns-1:
#They #are indigenous plants.
 [lit: It are indigenous plants]
personal-pronouns-her: #Haar heb ik op de markt gezien (niet hem).
(It is) #her I have seen on the market (not him).
personal-pronouns-het_hem:
[#Het boek]
 Ik heb #het op de bovenste plank gezet.

[#The book]
 I put #it on the top shelf.

[#De film]
 We hebben #hem nog niet gezien.

[#The film]
 We have not seen #it yet.
personal-pronouns-them: Ze vroeg #hun of ze mee wilden komen.
She asked #them whether they wanted to come along.
Ze vroeg aan #hen of ze mee wilden komen.
She asked (to) #them whether they wanted to come along.
personal-pronouns-ze: Ze vroeg #ze of ze mee wilden komen.
She asked #them whether they wanted to come with us.
Ze vroeg aan #ze of ze mee wilden komen.
She asked (to) #them whether they wanted to come with us.
